In a bowl, toss cauliflower with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread in an even layer on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Roast for 20–25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until edges of the cauliflower start to brown and florets are tender. Remove from oven, let cool for a few minutes, then transfer to a large bowl.
Slice hard-boiled eggs in half, then slice each half into 4 pieces. Roughly chop the bacon slices. Add the eggs and bacon to the bowl, along with cheddar cheese and scallions.
In a separate bowl, whisk dressing ingredients together until smooth. Pour dressing over cauliflower and toss to coat everything well. Garnish with extra sliced scallions before serving.
Enjoy!

title: Roasted Veggies With Spinach Pesto Orzo

Ingredients: 12 oz broccolini (350 g), cut into 1-inch pieces
12 oz yellow squash (340 g), seeded and cut into ½-inch wide half moons
12 oz red onion, cut into ½-inch wide slices
½ cup extra virgin olive oil (120 mL), plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided
freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 ½ cups uncooked orzo pasta (150 g)

description: Savor the vibrant flavors of Roasted Veggies with Spinach Pesto Orzo, a delightful medley of colorful veggies and orzo pasta. This scrumptious dish, bursting with fresh spinach pesto, will have you coming back for seconds!
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Spread the broccolini, squash, and red onion on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
Roast the vegetables for 20 minutes, until the broccolini is beginning to crisp and the squash and onions are tender. Remove from the oven and set aside.

While the vegetables are roasting, make the spinach pesto: In a food processor, combine the spinach, walnuts, lemon zest, garlic, lemon juice, and red pepper flakes. With the processor running, slowly stream in the remaining ½ cup of olive oil until the pesto reaches a smooth, thick, and spreadable consistency.
Cook the orzo according to package instructions.
Add ¾ cup of the pesto to the warm orzo and toss to coat. Mix in the roasted vegetables and more pesto to taste.
Serve warm or chilled.
Enjoy!

title: Grilled Wings 4 Ways

Zesty: 1 ½ tablespoons Tasty McCormick Zesty Seasoning
Savory: 1 ½ tablespoons Tasty McCormick Savory Seasoning, plus 2 teaspoons, divided

description: Fire up the grill and get ready for wing-tastic flavors with these versatile and delicious grilled wings. From fiery and zesty to tangy and savory, these wings are a flavor explosion that will satisfy everyone's cravings. With four mouthwatering variations, these are perfect for tailgating, backyard cookouts, or a fun and easy dinner option.
steps: Fiery
Place wings in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and toss with Tasty McCormick Fiery Seasoning.
Heat grill to high heat. Place wings on the grill and close lid. Grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through.
Remove wings from grill. Squeeze the lime wedges over and garnish with minced cilantro.
Zesty
Place wings in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and toss with Tasty McCormick Zesty Seasoning.
Heat grill to high heat. Place wings on the grill and close lid. Grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through.
Remove wings from grill. Squeeze the lemon wedges over and garnish with basil leaves.
Jazzy
Place wings in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and toss with Tasty McCormick Jazzy Seasoning.

Heat grill to high heat. Place wings on the grill and close lid. Grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through. Remove wings from grill and set aside.
In a small pot over low heat, melt the butter. Add honey, apple cider vinegar, and salt and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat.
Drizzle grilled wings with honey butter.
Savory
Place wings in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and toss with 1½ tablespoons Tasty McCormick Savory Seasoning.

Heat grill to high heat. Place wings on the grill and close lid. Grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through. Remove wings from grill and set aside.
In a small pot over low heat, melt the butter. Add 2 teaspoons Tasty McCormick Savory Seasoning. Bring to a simmer, then remove from heat.
Drizzle grilled wings with herb butter.
Enjoy!

title: Chicken Wings: Over Blue Yonder

Ingredients: ⅓ cup Great Value® Parmesan Garlic Wing Sauce (80 mL)
¼ cup Great Value® Blue Cheese Dressing (60 g)

description: Take your taste buds on a trip over the blue yonder with these savory chicken wings! Featuring a parmesan garlic sauce and crispy skins, they're a wing that'll transport you to flavor paradise.
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200˚C). Set a wire rack over a baking sheet.
Season the chicken wings with salt and pepper.
Bake the wings until cooked through and the skin is crispy, about 45 minutes.
Toss cooked wings in the wing sauce.
Serve the wings with blue cheese and French fries.
Enjoy!

title: Grilled Sausage Dinner: Pin-gnocchi-o - Jiminy Cricket!

Ingredients: 18 oz Sam’s Choice® potato gnocchi (510 g)
6.5 oz Sam’s Choice® Italia Basil Pesto Sauce (190 g)

description: This grilled sausage and cherry tomato gnocchi pesto dish is a cheesy and comforting crowd-pleaser that'll leave everyone satisfied. The plump and juicy sausages are sliced and paired with tender potato gnocchi, coated in a rich and flavorful basil pesto sauce. The addition of fresh and juicy cherry tomatoes adds a burst of sweetness and tanginess to this dish, while a sprinkle of grated parmesan cheese on top takes it to the next level of cheesy goodness. Perfect for a cozy family dinner or a potluck gathering.
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the gnocchi and cook until they begin to float, about 3 minutes.
In a small pot, bring the sauce to a simmer over medium heat. Add the tomatoes to the sauce and gently heat through, about 5 minutes.
Top the gnocchi with the sauce, grilled sausage and freshly grated Parmesan.
Enjoy!

title: Parfait: The Islander

Ingredients: 1 cup Great Value® Greek Yogurt (285 g), or Great Value® Nonfat Yogurt
½ cup mixed nuts and seeds (65 g)
½ cup fresh mixed fruit (90 g)
1 oz Great Value® Dark Chocolate (25 g), chopped

description: Take a trip to the tropics with this Islander Parfait! Layers of creamy yogurt, fruit, and nuts make for a refreshing and delicious parfait that'll transport you to a beach paradise.
steps: Spread the yogurt evenly in the bottom of a trifle glass. Top with the nuts and seeds, fruit, honey, and dark chocolate.
Enjoy!

title: Parfait: Cacao WOW

Ingredients: 1 cup Great Value® Greek Yogurt (285 g), or Great Value® Nonfat Yogurt
½ cup mixed nuts and seeds (65 g)
½ cup fresh mixed fruit (90 g), diced
1 oz Great Value® Dark Chocolate (25 g)

description: Layers of creamy Greek yogurt, rich dark chocolate pieces, and crunchy granola make for a parfait that's both satisfying and decadent. Whether you enjoy it for breakfast or as a dessert, this parfait is sure to leave you saying "wow!"
steps: Spread the yogurt evenly in the bottom of a trifle glass. Top with the nuts and seeds, fruit, maple syrup, and dark chocolate.
Enjoy!

title: Biscuit: Jam Slam

Ingredients: 4 cups all purpose flour (500 g), plus more for dusting
16 tablespoons unsalted butter, cubed and chilled
½ cup Great Value® Finely Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese (50 g)
9 oz TBJ® Classic Uncured Bacon Jam (245 g), for serving

description: Get ready to jam it up! These tender and flaky biscuits are the perfect vehicle for your favorite jams and preserves. From classic strawberry to tangy raspberry, these biscuits are a slam dunk of fruity goodness. One bite and you'll be in biscuit heaven.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Using your hands or a pastry cutter, work the butter into the dry ingredients, leaving large chunks.
Add the buttermilk and fold with a rubber spatula until fully incorporated and the dough comes together in a ball.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to about 2 inches (5 cm) thick.
Using a round pastry cutter, divide the dough into 12 pieces and place on the prepared baking sheet. Top each biscuit with cheddar cheese.
Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown.
Serve the biscuits with bacon jam and soft-boiled eggs.
Enjoy!

title: Grilled Sausage Dinner: The Mama Mia!

Ingredients: 18 oz Sam’s Choice® Italia Spaghetti (510 g)
6.5 oz Sam’s Choice® Italia Basil Pesto Sauce (190 g)

description: This grilled sausage and cherry tomato pesto spaghetti dish is a classic Italian favorite that'll have you reaching for seconds. The juicy and savory sausages are sliced and paired with tender spaghetti noodles, coated in a rich and vibrant basil pesto sauce. The addition of fresh and juicy cherry tomatoes adds a burst of sweetness and tanginess to this dish, while a sprinkle of grated parmesan cheese on top takes it to the next level of cheesy goodness. Perfect for a family dinner or a potluck gathering.
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente, about 10 minutes.
In a small pot, bring the sauce to a simmer over medium heat. Add the tomatoes to the sauce and gently heat through, about 5 minutes.
Top the pasta with the sauce, grilled sausage and freshly grated Parmesan.
Enjoy!

title: Rotisserie Chicken Dinner: Coop, There It Is!

Ingredients: 1 Marketside® Traditional Rotisserie Chicken, light meat
¼ cup red wine vinaigrette (60 mL), or balsamic vinaigrette

description: The juicy and succulent chicken pairs perfectly with roasted squash for a delightful dinner that will make your taste buds sing.
steps: Using a fork, poke holes into the butternut squash package. Microwave the package for 2–4 minutes, or until the squash is tender. Season the squash with salt and pepper.
Separate the 2 wings and 2 breasts from the chicken
Dress the salad greens with the vinaigrette.
Serve the chicken with the steamed butternut squash, salad, and grilled asparagus.
Enjoy!

title: Rotisserie Chicken Dinner: The Legacy

Ingredients: 1 Marketside® Traditional Rotisserie Chicken, light meat only
¼ cup red wine vinaigrette, or balsamic vinaigrette

description: The tender and juicy chicken is served with a medley of cauliflower and asparagus, creating a perfect combination of textures and flavors. It's an easy and convenient meal that's perfect for any night of the week, and is sure to become a family favorite for years to come.
steps: Using a fork, poke holes into the cauliflower package. Microwave the package for 2–4 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender. Season the cauliflower with salt and pepper.
Separate the 2 wings and 2 breasts from the chicken.
Dress the tomato salad with vinaigrette.
Serve the chicken with the steamed cauliflower, tomato salad, and grilled asparagus.
Enjoy!

title: Smoothies: Almond Brothers

Ingredients: 1 cup Great Value® Almond Milk (240 mL)
1 ½ cups Great Value® Berry Medley (260 g)

description: This smoothie is nuts - in the best way possible! Featuring almond milk, berries and coconut chips, it's a smoothie that's packed with flavor. Get ready to go nuts for the Almond Brothers!
steps: In a blender, combine the almond milk, berries, honey, and coconut chips. Blend on high speed until smooth.
Enjoy!

title: Fried Rice: Sailor’s Scramble

Ingredients: 2 cups extra large shrimp (650 g), peeled and deveined

description: A hearty and flavorful fried rice recipe that's perfect for satisfying your hunger. Loaded with shrimp and veggies, this dish is packed with flavor and nutrition.
steps: In a medium bowl, combine the shrimp and teriyaki sauce. Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
In a large pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the marinated shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 5 minutes. Remove the shrimp from pan and set aside.
To the same pan, add the kimchi and eggs to the pan and cook until the eggs are set, about 3 minutes.
Add the rice, soy sauce, and sesame oil and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Serve warm.
Enjoy!

title: Jackie-O Cocktail: The Trendy AF

Ingredients: ½ oz crème de cassis (15 mL)

description: This content is intended solely for users of legal drinking age. Drink responsibly.
steps: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the crème de cassis, cognac, and cranberry juice. Shake for 20 seconds, then strain into a coupe glass.
Top with sparkling rosé and garnish with an orange peel.
Enjoy!

title: Jackie-O Cocktail: The Fruits des Bois

Ingredients: ½ oz crème de cassis (15 mL)

description: This content is intended solely for users of legal drinking age. Drink responsibly.
steps: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the crème de cassis, cognac, and cranberry juice. Shake for 20 seconds, then strain into a coupe glass.
Top with sparkling rosé and garnish with a flower.
Enjoy!

title: Jackie-O Cocktail: The Coquette

Ingredients: ½ oz crème de cassis (15 mL)

description: This content is intended solely for users of legal drinking age. Drink responsibly.

title: Breakfast Waffle: The Peculiar Chooser
description: The Extra is a waffle that's all about indulgence. The crispy waffle base is topped with a generous pour of boysenberry syrup, giving it a sweet and tangy kick. A sprinkle of powdered sugar adds a touch of sweetness, while chocolate chips bring a rich and chocolatey flavor to the dish. To top it off, a handful of colorful sprinkles are scattered on top, adding a fun and playful touch to this delicious breakfast treat. With every bite, you'll experience a delightful combination of sweet, tangy, and chocolatey flavors, along with a crispy and crunchy texture. It's a breakfast waffle that's perfect for those who love to treat themselves to a little something extra.
steps: Preheat a waffle iron to medium-high heat. Grease with nonstick spray.
OPTION 1: If using prepared mix, in a medium bowl, whisk together the waffle mix, milk, egg, and vegetable oil until fully incorporated.

OPTION 2: If making the waffle batter from scratch, in a medium bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.  In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, melted butter, and buttermilk. Whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until fully combined.
Add 1 cup (130 g) of waffle batter to the center of the waffle iron. Cook until the waffle is golden brown and cooked through, 4–6 minutes. Repeat with the remaining batter.
Top each waffle with 1 tablespoon boysenberry syrup and ½ teaspoon powdered sugar. Garnish with 1 tablespoon chocolate chips and 1 teaspoon sprinkles.
Enjoy!

title: Breakfast Waffle: The Expert Brunch-er
description: The crispy waffle base is topped with a medley of sweet and tart mixed berries, a generous swirl of whipped cream, and a drizzle of pure maple syrup. The finishing touch of rainbow sprinkles adds a fun and colorful twist to this sophisticated breakfast. With every bite, you'll experience a delightful balance of flavors and textures.
steps: Preheat a waffle iron to medium-high heat. Grease with nonstick spray.
OPTION 1: If using prepared mix, in a medium bowl, whisk together the waffle mix, milk, egg, and vegetable oil until fully incorporated.

OPTION 2: If making the waffle batter from scratch, in a medium bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.  In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, melted butter, and buttermilk. Whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until fully combined.
Add 1 cup (130 g) of waffle batter to the center of the waffle iron. Cook until the waffle is golden brown and cooked through, 4–6 minutes. Repeat with the remaining batter.
Top each waffle with 1 tablespoon maple syrup and 2 tablespoons whipped cream. Garnish with ¼ cup (45 g) mixed berries and 1 teaspoon sprinkles.
Enjoy!

title: Milkshake: The Tiffany

Ingredients: ⅔ cup whole milk (160 mL), or coconut milk
1 ½ cups dairy-free vanilla ice cream (225 g), or regular vanilla ice cream

description: Indulge in a sweet treat with this milkshake, featuring vanilla ice cream and chunks of chocolate candy blended together. Topped with sprinkles and caramel sauce, this milkshake is a classic favorite.
steps: In a blender, combine the milk, ice cream, and candy pieces. Blend on medium speed until fully combined, about 2 minutes.
Pour the shake into a pint glass and top with the sprinkles. Finish with a drizzle of caramel sauce.
Enjoy!

title: Milkshake: The Caramel Alon

Ingredients: ⅔ cup whole milk (160 g), or cocounut milk
1 ½ cups dairy-free vanilla ice cream (225 g), or regular vanilla icescream

description: This milkshake is the ultimate indulgence, with rich candy pieces swirled throughout and a generous drizzle of caramel sauce on top. It's perfect for satisfying your sweet tooth and cooling off on a hot day.
steps: In a blender, combine the milk, ice cream, and candy pieces. Blend on medium speed until fully combined, about 2 minutes.
Pour the shake into a pint glass and top with the marshmallows. Finish with a drizzle of caramel sauce.
Enjoy!

title: Sangria: The Blush Andréa

Ingredients: ⅓ cup dark rum (80 mL), or brandy

description: This content is intended solely for users of legal drinking age. Drink responsibly.
steps: In a pitcher, combine the red wine, apple juice, raspberries, strawberries, and rum. Chill for at least 1 hour.
Pour into a wine glass and garnish with a strawberry half.
Enjoy!

title: Sangria: The Ruby

Ingredients: ⅓ cup dark rum (80 mL), or brandy

description: This content is intended solely for users of legal drinking age. Drink responsibly.
steps: In a pitcher, combine the red wine, orange juice, mango, pineapple, and rum. Chill for at least 1 hour.
Pour into a wine glass and garnish with an orange slice.
Enjoy!

title: Meal Prep Meatballs And Sauce

Ingredients: ½ cup whole milk ricotta cheese (125 g)
¼ cup bread crumbs (30 g), unseasoned
¼ cup fresh parsley (10 g), packed, roughly chopped
1 tablespoon McCormick® Oregano Leaves, divided, plus 1 teaspoon
4 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste
2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
1 small yellow onion, 1/4 in (6 ml) diced
freshly grated parmesan cheese, to taste
1 head green leaf lettuce, torn, divided
½ cup shredded low moisture mozzarella cheese (50 g)

description: Meal prep just got a whole lot tastier with these juicy, flavorful meatballs and zesty tomato sauce! Packed with protein and bursting with flavor, they're the perfect addition to any meal prep routine. Whip up a batch and enjoy the convenience of having delicious, home-cooked meals ready to go all week long!
steps: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, ricotta, 1 egg, the bread crumbs, parsley, 1½ tablespoons dried oregano, ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes, and 2 teaspoons salt. Mix well with your hands.
Using a 1-inch (2 ½ cm) scoop, portion the mixture into 46 meatballs. Roll with your hands into smooth balls.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. 4. Working in batches, sear the meatballs on all sides, until well browned, about 5 minutes. Remove the meatballs from the pot and set aside.
To the same pot, add the onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, 1½ teaspoons oregano, 2 teaspoons salt, ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes, and the vinegar and bring to a boil.
Return the meatballs to the pot with the sauce, cover, and let simmer for 45 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through.
Day 1 - Linguine and Meatballs. Cook the linguine according to the package instructions. Meanwhile, reheat 1½ cups (500 G) of sauce and 10 meatballs.
To serve, divide the linguine between 2 bowls and top each serving with 5 meatballs and ¾ cup sauce. Garnish with freshly grated Parmesan cheese.
Enjoy!
Day 2 - Meatball Sliders. Cut 6 meatballs in half.

Separate the tops and bottom buns of 6 Hawaiian rolls. Spread the yellow mustard over the bottom buns. Top with the meatballs, roasted red peppers, ½ head of torn lettuce, and 3 tablespoons of pickled red onions. Top with the top buns.
Enjoy!

Day 3 - Pizza Pockets. Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Roll the pizza dough out to an 8 x 12-inch (20 x  30 cm) rectangle and cut into 4 equal pieces. Transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Spoon 3 meatballs and sauce onto the top center of each piece of dough.
Sprinkle 2 tablespoons shredded mozzarella across meatballs.
Fold the bottom half of the dough over the meatballs and crimp the edges to seal. Beat the remaining egg, then brush over the dough.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
Enjoy!

Day 4 - Meatball Salad. Preheat the oven to 425˚F (220˚C). Tear 2 Hawaiian rolls into small pieces and place in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper, drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil, and spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes, until golden and crispy.
In a large bowl, combine the remaining ½ head of green leaf lettuce, 8 meatballs, 1 cup croutons, and 3 tablespoons pickled red onion and drizzle with Caesar dressing. Toss to combine.
Enjoy!

title: Mini Muffulettas

Ingredients: 1 cup kalamata olive (180 g), drained, pitted
½ cup roasted red pepper (50 g), roughly chopped
⅓ cup extra virgin olive oil (80 mL)

description: Looking for a party-perfect snack? These Mini Muffulettas are the way to go! Piled high with ham, salami, cheese, and an olive salad, they're bursting with bold, zesty flavors.
steps: Make the olive salad: Add the olives, red peppers, capers, pepper, Italian seasoning, celery seeds, red pepper flakes, and giardiniera to a food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped. Transfer to a medium bowl and whisk in the olive oil. Cover and set aside.

Make the muffalettas: Cut off the top ⅓ of each boule and set aside. Carefully remove the inside of the loaf, leaving about a ½-inch-thick (1 ¼ cm) layer of bread behind. Reserve the bread scraps for another use.

Add a large spoonful of olive salad to the bottom of the bread bowls and spread evenly. Layer 4 slices of salami, 4 slices of mortadella, 4 slices of sopressata, and 2 slices of provolone in each loaf. Top with another layer of olive salad and spread evenly. Cover with the bread tops. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, up to overnight.
When ready to serve, slice the muffalettas into quarters.
Enjoy!

title: Chicken Caesar Flatbread Bowl

Ingredients: ⅓ cup self-rising flour (40 g), plus more for dusting
Salad: 8 oz boneless, skinless chicken breast (225 g)
¼ cup extra virgin olive oil (60 mL), divided
1 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish

description: Why not make your entire meal edible, even the bowl you serve it in?! The three-ingredient flatbread bowl is easy to whip up for lunch or a fun dinner, and all you have left to do is grill some chicken, throw together a yummy dressing, and assemble the salad. If you are running short on time, use store-bought Caesar dressing and shredded rotisserie chicken.
steps: Preheat the oven to 425˚F (220˚C).
Make the flatbread bowl: In a medium bowl, stir together the flour, salt, and yogurt with a flexible spatula to combine. Knead the dough with your hands until a smooth ball forms, about 5 minutes.

Lightly dust a clean work surface with flour. Turn out the dough and roll out to a 9-inch (22.5 cm) round as thin as a sheet of paper. Rotate the round occasionally to help the dough hold its shape. Lightly dust with flour as needed to keep the dough from sticking, but be careful not to use too much flour, which will make the flatbread tough.

Invert an 8-inch (20 cm) metal bowl so the domed side faces up. Grease the bowl generously with nonstick spray, then spray one side of the dough. Gently lay the dough, greased-side down, over the bowl, pressing it flush against the surface. It’s fine if the dough folds over on itself in places. Grease the inside of the other bowl, then spray the exposed side of the dough. Press the second bowl over the dough. With a paring knife, trim any excess dough around the edges.

Transfer the bowls, still upside down, to a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, or until the dough is golden brown, lift the top bowl to check. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool for at least 15 minutes.

When the bowls are cool enough to handle, remove the top bowl. Gently invert the other bowl and let the flatbread bowl slide off. Let cool completely on the rack. It will continue to crisp as it cools.
Make the salad: Season the chicken breast on both sides with salt and pepper.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken until deep golden brown, about 6 minutes per side, or until the thickest part of the chicken reaches 165°F (75˚C)  on an instant-read thermometer. Remove the chicken from the pan and let rest for 5 minutes.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, garlic, mustard, Parmesan, and salt to taste. Drizzle in the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a slow, steady stream, whisking constantly to emulsify. Stir in the yogurt until smooth. Season with pepper to taste, if desired.
Once the chicken has rested, thinly slice.
Fill the flatbread bowl with the romaine, then top with the sliced chicken, croutons, dressing, and Parmesan cheese.
Enjoy!
